thread.title: Big Vehicles Power Surge in GM’s Profit
thread.title_full: Big Vehicles Power Surge in GM’s Profit

title: Big Vehicles Power Surge in GM’s Profit
text:
Big Vehicles Power Surge in GM’s Profit Auto maker forecasts a healthy second-half performance By gautham.nagesh@wsj.com Updated July 23, 2015 9:52 a.m. ET 
General Motors Co. kept on trucking in the second quarter despite slower growth in China, as the popularity of its pickups and sport-utility vehicles led the company to top analyst expectations and forecast stronger second-half results. 
The No. 1 U.S. auto maker by revenue reported $1.12 billion in profit, up from $278 million in last year’s second quarter. Revenue fell $1.4 billion from a year earlier to $38.2 billion as the... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
